name: Poly Multisample
description: Polyphonic sample player (records and plays WAV files), controllable via CV/gate, MIDI, or I2C.

parameters.name: Sample -1 -1 Allows you to choose a single sample within the folder to play, or "<MULTISAMPLE>" for the usual case where you want the algorithm to choose the sample automatically based on the note pitch. Gain
Fine tune
parameters.description: cents Adjusts the tuning in cents.

parameters.name: 0 1 0 The standard polysynth sustain mode parameter. See above. Sustain
parameters.description: Directly controls the sustain (like a MIDI sustain

parameters.name: pedal). Gate offset
parameters.description: Offsets (delays) the gate inputs relative to the pitch

parameters.name: 0 3 0 The round-robin mode. See above. Loop
parameters.description: Sets whether the sample will loop. 'From WAV file'

parameters.name: will loop if the sample has loop points defined in the file - see above - and not otherwise. 'Off' and 'On' force the sample to loop or not. Bend range
Confirm change
parameters.description: Sets whether the folder and/or sample changes

parameters.name: Envelope
parameters.description: Enables an ADSR volume envelope. If the

parameters.name: envelope is disabled, the sample simply plays once until the end. Attack
parameters.description: Sets the envelope attack time (from 1ms to 15s,

parameters.name: exponential response). Decay
parameters.description: Sets the envelope decay time (from 20ms to 15s,

parameters.name: Release
parameters.description: Sets the envelope release time (from 10ms to 30s,

parameters.name: exponential response). Velocity
parameters.description: Sets the amount by which the note velocity affects

parameters.name: MPE channels
parameters.description: Controls how the algorithm will respond to MPE.
